name: Bocado
address: 1293 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

reviews.text: Service was excellent. Our flatbread was ok but not as "flavorful" as I'd hoped. It was a bit loud because everyone is seated on top of each other. But overall a great vibe.
Nice but somewhat overpriced.

Randomly walked into this place on a Saturday night and so glad we did- it was a lovely place with a lovely atmosphere! It isn't obnoxious with 500 TVs blaring in your face, and the servers are very attentive. I believe it's only wine and beer at the bar, but it's a good place if you just want to chat with friends and catch up :) They have a decent selection of food as well- I was very satisfied with the pesto rigatoni
It‚Äôs such a surprise they will give you a mimosa for free if you buy any brunch there! Really cozy atmosphere too!
Very Attentive, quick and delicious!!!
Definitely not our favorite place‚Ä¶ the Food took 20 minutes to arrive and the place was empty. The salmon omelette was the best of everything we ordered. The portions are huge!
After work dinner and drinkns. Service is incredible.  The food..so tasty. I had the fried fish sandwich with mango salsa. Sooo yummy....I would definitely come back
Delicious food

Great food‚Ä¶ excellent service ‚Ä¶.. very cozy
Very happy with everything üòä
Amazing food and service! 10/10 highly recommend! Definitely will be back
Polite and efficient staff. Good food, pricy, and ok.
Some of the worst food I‚Äôve ever had, not sure how it‚Äôs open
Tr√®s bonne exp√©rience,  cuisine excellente, cadre tr√®s agr√©able et notre serveuse √©tait tr√®s sympa !! Je recommande...
Our server Ara was outstanding. Food was even better than we expected although we chose Bocado because of the menu online. Thank you for a great experience.

Fellow, weary travelers, if you‚Äôre visiting New York and you‚Äôre on your way to the Met and you‚Äôre having a hard day walk 10 minutes over to this space and have yourself a wonderful ros√© and experience some very friendly people. I‚Äôve had a‚Ä¶

I went to Bocado for dinner before attending Shakespeare on the park later that night. Bocado was not my initial restaurant of choice, but finding that one full I remembered this was nearby. I am so glad I did! The food was phenomenal! I had the grilled steak with fingerling potatoes and asparagus. Everything was cooked to perfection. This might have been the best steak I‚Äôve had in months. The service was OK. And if the weight staff had been a bit more attentive to the diminishing level of my drink, this restaurant easily could have gotten a full 5-stars. As it turned out, this meal was the best part of the evening, because the performance of Shakespeare was sadly disappointing.
Would like to try more other foods on the menu next time im in the area
Fine and ok priced but my steak frites was pork ü´†‚Ä¶

Stopped in after an evening at the Guggenheim not too far away and were automatically greeted by such a warm and welcoming host.

We were promptly served our pitcher of red sangria by our attentive server as he guided us through our selections of delicious bites including the Bocado fries, sea scallops, and flatbread with prosciutto.
Shoutout to Michael, great service and very friendly.

Love this restaurant
Come here all the time .
Awesome
So yummy
Pretty good food! Nice little spot to walk in. No reservation needed. Hit the mark!
I had a very delicious shrimp carbonara!  My server, Alexa remembered me from my first visit last week.  She again did a great job taking care of me.

Food was so good
Service was ok
It's hard to pick a favorite dish because they‚Äôre all so good.

Wir haben nicht reserviert und bekamen trotzdem einen Platz. Das Essen war 10/10 super lecker und die Bedienung sehr aufmerksam! Sie schenkten uns immer wieder das Wasser nach wir haben knapp 60$ ausgegeben.
I enjoyed it

Went for Sunday brunch - group of 4. Reserved table beforehand, no wait. Brunch comes with a drink - Bellini, mimosa, orange juice, or coffee. OJ tasted fresh, pulp which I like. We spent about $35 pp. Felt on the pricier side especially waffles, pancakes for $25-27 which we did not opt for. Still, would return as a special outing with friends for good food at a convenient location with good ambiance.
Pictured: crab cake burger, omelettes, eggs Benedict.
Great place in NYC. Fish and Chips marvelous. Bocado Burger super tasty. Atmosphere great. Love all of it. Thank you.
High quality food and service
Cozy place with good service and friendly people. The food is excellent and the price is fair, here you can eat a good Tiramisu and drink a homemade beer.

Found this place randomly after a night at the museum. The service was so quick despite how busy it was. The wine was refreshing and the food was flavorful! Loved the little outdoor seating. Will definitely be back to try their pasta, it smelt sooooo good!
Great burger, attentive staff
Airport quality food at airport prices.
Very huge portions of breakfast. it‚Äôs delicious as well: ordered steak and eggs and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. Service was awesome.

We stumbled upon Bocado Cafe while working in New York, and it turned out to be the perfect find. The atmosphere was cozy and welcoming, the service was friendly, and the food was fresh and delicious. It quickly became one of our favorite spots to take a break and recharge during the day.

Oh my god, the food was so good here!! The service was def not the best, as we had to ask for bread, and had to ask for check after quite a bit, and then still wait a bit more. But I will most def be returning as my meal was heavenly!! Portions are big too!

We found Bocado Cafe while venturing through the Upper West Side in NY- it was a good pick and I would definitely recommend if you're looking for somewhere to sit, relax and have a good meal, even if you're in a rush. I had the pear salad with chicken, my sister had the Fish and Chips (appetizer version)- which was quite large and filling. They have an extensive wine menu so if you're also looking for a refreshing, crisp glass of wine, Bocado is a great pick. My favorite part of this restaurant was not only the food, but the ambiance and decor throughout. We are glad we found this restaurant!

The service is incredible here! The staff really care about your dining experience. The waiter was so attentive and the food was delicious.

I was headed to the Met and needed to grab something to eat‚Äî so glad I gave Bocado a try!
Reliably good food and atmosphere with more affordable prices. A good neighborhood spot.
Went for lunch, place is cute, food was good.
Great local place, with excellent breakfast, well prepared and excellent service.
The food was great, especially the Mediterranean lamb burger perfectly cooked and full of flavor. The staff was also incredibly friendly and welcoming. I‚Äôd definitely come back!

We took a trip to New York recently with our toddler and were nervous that there wouldn‚Äôt be many kid friendly restaurants. The staff at Bocado was very attentive and kind. I really enjoyed the chicken fettuccine and rosemary wings. Would go back!
awesome food

Food was great - perfectly portioned. The crab cake burger and halloumi chicken sandwich were delicious, as were the bellinis. My kids loved the pizza and chicken tenders from the kids menu. I loved the atmosphere, a very family friendly lunch or great spot to bring your friends. Louie was fantastic, so nice!
Food was great. The service staff was very attentive. Highly recommend the flatbreads!

Excellent service, the manager Jose is very very pleasant and helpful, Lu is so attentive and quick. Will definitely go back there. Food is so good went there for brunch with my family and enjoyed it we had great experience.

I gave one star just cause the manager it's more than rude, if you're in customer service you should smile and be nice all the time, even if you didn't have a good day, it's not customers fault, even with the staff he's rude, please take care of the staff, owner should be aware how does manager jose treat all the employees, cause all the staff has an amazing attitude and the restaurant can lose really good employees just cause they had a grumpy manager

Great food and service. We had a burger and a turkey sandwich. Both were really good! The portion size was also large and both plates came with fries. The sandwich was delicious. My favorite. Thanks for everything.

Food 3/5 Bland. I understand that omelettes are supposed to be a certain way and I give a pass for me having to add salt but there was literally no flavor or other seasonings. I am unsure if this is some purist mentality for omelettes but I am not for it, and for $25 I was shocked by the lack of flavor. Only thing that my food had going for it was the dressing for my arugula salad and the toast with butter

Service was good but felt like I was being rushed out the door when already standing putting on my coat.

I‚Äôm going to start implementing a rule because a trend I have noticed with more expensive restaurants is the food is more lackluster. My theory is that restaurants that can afford to set lower prices for food is because their food is good, popular, and able to compensate with high volume and sales to make up for lower price.

Service was stellar.
Clean bathrooms.
We had a reservation for a large party we were seated and served quickly.
Everyone enjoyed their meal and the lunch prefix really hit the spot.  Truffle feta fries were a hit as well as the calamari.  Fresh ingredients used for veggie burgers. We blindly chose this restaurant because of proximity to MET.  I will definitely return and recommend others.

I‚Äôve walked by Bacado‚Äôs restaurant many times in route to the 92nd Street Y and it‚Äôs always busy. It‚Äôs an unusual restaurant since it‚Äôs open from 8:30 am til 10pm . I went there for breakfast and actually walked in a few minutes before they opened and the interior with a beautiful bar seems more appealing for lunch or dinner but i had an excellent breakfast: poached eggs on avocado toast with a salad and a latte. I am looking forward to many more meals here! The  service was excellent and soon after i arrived, the restaurant began to fill up with customers!

Really enjoyed the soft ambiance and the friendly service here. It‚Äôs such a cozy, romantic spot to come enjoy a glass of wine and some appetizers. Very impressive wine list! The prices are a bit steep for the dishes offered, but delicious nonetheless. Also: don‚Äôt miss out on their delicious bread that they serve before the meal - the buns in particular were so fresh and memorable.

Nothing to brag about. Decent food in a nice ambiance.
We came here for brunch. Service was good, fast, and friendly.
My steak was undercooked!
I will try them during the week.

Today we ordered a dinner set, mussels, and steak and Frites. The bread was average. The mussels had good flavor, but a bit too salty. In addition, the mussels are too tiny, see photo 5. The dinner set we choose Caesar salad, Bocado burger, and Tiramisu. Everything was pretty good. The salad dressing was very nice and not overpowering. The burger patty was thick and juicy, and they were very generous with the avocado slices and cheese. The steak and frites were very good. The steak was well seasoned and very tender. The frites were nice crispy and thick. I was able to taste the slightly sweetness of the potatoes. The roasted carrots were nice, too. Tiramisu was very delicious. Overall, it was a nice meal, but spent more money than I expected.

Delightful meal with a friend. She chose salmon, and I chose to have the fixed menu meal...Caesar Salad, rosemary chicken, and tiamusui were perfection.

Intimate setting, yet you feel like you have privacy.

Loved it.

Went on a Sunday for early brunch. The food was phenomenal. Burger was messy and great - the raw onions could have been excluded. My cousin said the waffle was maybe the best she has ever had. A good outside crunch w a very soft interior.

The latte was very frothy and full of flavor. The mimosa w fresh squeezed orange juice was superior. I would DEF come back.

Loved everything about this place! The wait staff was super friendly and the food was absolutely delicious. What a great find on our walk around the upper East side. I highly recommend you stopping in for a meal.

Very chic little restaurant! Got the Bocado burger, which was as huge as it was delicious. Great vibes - the little lights everywhere added a whimsical flare to our meal. Avocado on the burger was perfectly ripe, and the fries were delicious as well.
Had an excellent lunch here. The staff was very attentive and managed to squeeze us in without a reservation. Food was delicious, complementary mimosas for Saturday Brunch were a nice touch ü•Ç

This place is a fantastic brunch spot on the UES! üçΩÔ∏è  Bocado offers a fantastic selection of breakfast food üç≥, salads ü•ó, pancakes ü•û, and more! Definitely try the Nutella üå∞ Crepe and Avocado ü•ë and Poached Eggsü•ö with Sourdough Bread! üçû Weekend brunch orders come with complimentary mimosas ü•Ç, fresh juice üßÉ, or coffee! ‚òï Staff üë®‚Äçüç≥ is friendly and professional and service is quick! I wish I knew about this place earlier!

First, the service is great and attentive. I liked my lamb burger a lot, and it was cooked exactly to my preference. The seafood linguine was very, very generous, but the noodles were over cooked. Unfortunately, with just two entrees, we were at $77 total. The value is not there‚Ä¶

We were delighted with everything! Our server was attentive. The beers were refreshing and our choices for lunch were delicious. The bocado avocado is something I would definitely order again and the lamb burger was perfect! We shared a cheesecake for dessert and it was everything we were hoping for.
Came here for breakfast because of the good reviews and how close it is to The Met. Huge delicious plates of food. Delicious cappuccino/latte. Definitely recommended!

Very clean place with quick service. We went around 12:00 during the week and there was no wait and barely anyone there. The staff is very quick to take your order when you‚Äôre ready. The food here is a good portion for the price and the taste is great. I would recommend going here but if you‚Äôre a picky eater maybe check the menu first (they have great fries though).

I recently visited a bustling brunch spot, and while the ambiance was lively, but it gets really busy so I would suggest making reservations early on.
Service: The service at this establishment was prompt for the most part. Our coffees and water were refilled without having to ask, which was appreciated. However, I found it off-putting when the waiter asked if we wanted the check while we were still enjoying our food. It felt a bit rushed and could have been handled more tactfully.
Food: The food had its ups and downs. The French toast, served with maple syrup on the side, was satisfying and met expectations. However, the avocado toast with poached eggs fell short. It lacked seasoning, leaving it bland and unremarkable. Additionally, the side salad accompanying the dish was uninspired, lacking flavor and freshness.
Overall, while the ambiance and some aspects of the service were enjoyable, the inconsistency in the food quality detracted from the overall experience.

Picked this spot for a quick drink before my movie and decided to return for dinner later afterwards. The staff was so friendly and attentive, the decor was very cute and homey. The wine selection was interesting, the Bordeaux stole my taste buds. The food was excellent with perfect portions for dine in and take home additional. I will definitely be returning to this unassuming gem üíé

Breakfast, brunch, lunch, and dinner. Reasonably priced, very clean. You can feel the vibrations from the subway. Hi Lenny of outdoor and indoor seating. We went around 5pm on Wednesday and it wasn‚Äôt crowded so we were able to enjoy our lattes and have a chat without any struggle. The lava cake with ice cream was amazing. Staff was friendly.

This is a beautiful restaurant. I sat at the bar and had the full attention of so many wine bottles. I ordered the Baby rocket Arugula salad and it was incredible. The grilled chicken was absolute perfection tender juicy. I also ordered Fried Calamari the appetizer and the meat nestled inside was so delicate and tender that it basically melted in my mouth. Yay! I had to stop myself from inhaling it and asking for more. it's a perfect portion, I was full without being stuffed. It seems the staff helps each other out in a manner that is pleasant and kind. Thanks to my server, Phillip. Definitely will come back and recommend to my friends.
Their salads and they were very refreshing and tasty. The spinach linguini was also delicious. Everything was good at this place and we were glad we walked by this restaurant and found it.

Decent brunch which includes free mimosa, coffee or OJ.

I enjoyed the chicken halloumi sandwich.

The lights were nice decor around the bar were pretty

Had a party of 9 they accomadated us with no problem.  We were in for brunch had our drinks and ordered our food.  Only took a few minutes for our food to arrive.  The food was plentiful and delicious.   The waitress was a master of her‚Ä¶
Stopped here after a dance class. Loved the food and atmosphere. You have to try the truffle fries! The servers were genuinely nice. Definitely going back!

Came here for a quick bite after my doctor appointment during lunch and it was great.  I don't normally write reviews especially for lunch but the chicken Alfredo was so fresh and delicious.  I also had a glass of white sangria and  the prosciutto and fig Flatbread.  Big portion nut also great. I'll come back for the dinner menu.

Service was soild and everyone had a smile.
Great food, atmosphere, and location. Haven't been for a full meal yet, just a couple times for quick bites, but everything was very promising.

The food and service in Bocado are hands-down excellent and top-notch. My family and I were treated really well during Christmas Eve dinner even if we did not have a prior reservation. It is now our go-to dining spot in New York City!
